result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Valerie A. Perez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
10:06 a.m. Defendant Valerie A. Perez in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Defendant Valerie A. Perez in custody.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Eric Klemm, under the student practice rule. Calling 16cm245, 15ct144, 16cm26, 16tr193, 16tr1583. Burns statement to resolution. In 15ct144 and 16cm26, State moves to dismiss but read-in - Granted. In 16cm245, State  moves to dismiss but read-in Counts 1 and 4 - Granted. State moves to dismiss 16tr1583 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant pleads no contest to Counts 2 and 3 in 16cm245 and Count 1 in 16tr193.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Off record. 
On record 10:25 a.m. - Court states that it became apparent that findings needed to be made under 967.055 if 16tr1583 is dismissed. State moves to amend complaint in 16cm245 to add Count 5 of OWI - 2nd occurring on 5/30/2016 - Granted. Defendant enters no contest plea to that Count also. Court reads on waiver of rights and tending plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court does not need to make findings under 967.055 as offense has been added to 16cm245.

Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Klemm/Burns/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
16cm245 - Counts 2 and 3 cc
WHS/POP - 18 months
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO. 

16cm245 - Count 5 (OWI count added)
Fine - $1429
Jail - 5 days (time served)
Jail credit - 17 days under 973.155
Driver's License revocation - 12 months
IID - 12 months
AODA assessment and follow-through
IID - 12 months

16tr193
Fine - $812
Driver's License revocation - 6 months
AODA assessment and follow-through

Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.

Adj. 10:36 a.m.  Review hearing scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

2:01 pm Defendant Valerie A. Perez in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Eric Klemm, under the student practice rule. Calling 15ct144, 16CM26, 16tr193. Burns statement - waiting to get license reinstated in Indiana and there is conflicting information regarding test results; not quite ready to resolve at this date. Bail continued. Adj. 2:07 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 21, 2016 at 11:30 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

1:43 p.m. MJB for PFO. Defendant Valerie A. Perez in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cm26 and 16tr193. Intra circuit transfer to Branch 2.   In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Bednar statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond. Case 15ct144 and all traffic citations to be calendared/track with this case. Adj. 1:46 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
